original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati!

original: mtshams sbyor ba chad nas ni mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid du shes pa'ang med do //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba chad nas ni mtshams sbyor ba dang / mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid du shes pa'ang med do //
translated: Once the connection is severed, there is no connection and no knowledge of the characteristics of connection.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: Moreover, MahƒÅmati!

original: gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen dang / bya ba sbyor ba la mngon par chags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rnams kyi mtshams sbyor te /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen dang / bya ba sbyor ba la mngon par chags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa rnams kyi mtshams sbyor te /

original: bar chad med par 'jug pa'i tshul du mngon par chags pas srid pa'i mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bar chad med par 'jug pa'i tshul du mngon par chags pas srid pa'i mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through attachment to the mode of uninterrupted engagement, they are connected to existence.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen las bzlog pa dang / rnam par thar pa gsum ma mthong bas mtshams sbyor ba thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen las bzlog pa dang / rnam par thar pa gsum ma mthong bas mtshams sbyor ba thams cad mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The connection of all [consciousnesses] does not occur through the reversal of the condition of the convergence of the three of the consciousnesses and through not seeing the three liberations.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: Regarding that, it is said:

original: yang dag ma yin yongs rtog ni //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin yongs rtog ni //
translated: The incorrect imagination

original: mtshams sbyor mtshan nyid ces bya ste //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor mtshan nyid ces bya ste //

original: de ni yang dag yongs shes na //
analyzed: de ni yang dag yongs shes na //

original: mtshams sbyor ba yi dra ba 'chad //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba yi dra ba 'chad //

original: dngos por shes pa'i sgra 'dzin pas //
analyzed: dngos por shes pa'i sgra 'dzin pas //
translated: By grasping at the sound of knowing things,

original: ji ltar dar gyi srin bu bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar dar gyi srin bu bzhin //

original: byis @192a *// pa mtshams sbyor mi mkhas pa //
analyzed: byis @192a *// pa mtshams sbyor mi mkhas pa //

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pas 'ching //
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pas 'ching //
translated: Are bound by their own conceptualization.

original: yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: Again, MahƒÅmati said:

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang gis dngos po gang dang gang brtags pa de dag ni kun brtags pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du rnam par rtog pa gang dang gang gis dngos po gang dang gang brtags pa de dag ni kun brtags pa nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn, when the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄòWhatever conceptualization conceptualizes whatever thing, those are just conceptualizations,

original: de dag la rang bzhin med ngo zhes bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de dag la rang bzhin med ngo zhes bka' stsal pa /
translated: They have no intrinsic nature,‚Äô

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,

analyzed: de gal te kun brtags pa nyid lags te dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid mi rig na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad bka' stsal pa'i chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po'ang ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, BhagavƒÅn, since all phenomena that the BhagavƒÅn has taught are of the nature of conceptualization, things that are afflicted and purified will not exist.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said,üîΩ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, my teaching of the nature of conceptualization is not like that.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: de de bzhin tshe /
analyzed: de de bzhin tshe /
translated: it is just so.

original: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam par brtags pa de lta bur ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam par brtags pa de lta bur ma yin te /

original: de ni kun brtags pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni kun brtags pa nyid de /

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid mi rig go /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid mi rig go /
translated: for they do not know the nature and characteristics of things.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: 'on kyang 'phags pa rnams kyis 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / 'phags pa'i mthong ba dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar rtogs pa de lta bur dngos po'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'phags pa rnams kyis 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / 'phags pa'i mthong ba dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar rtogs pa de lta bur dngos po'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: however, the nature of things is just as it is realized by the noble ones with the eye of noble wisdom, noble vision, and noble insight.

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: MahƒÅmati said,

original: @192b bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: @192b bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn,

original: de gal te 'phags pa rnams kyis rdzu 'phrul dang / sha'i mig gis ma lags kyi 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / 'phags pa'i mthong ba dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa de bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gal te 'phags pa rnams kyis rdzu 'phrul dang / sha'i mig gis ma lags kyi 'phags pa'i ye shes dang / 'phags pa'i mthong ba dang / 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then it is not the case that the noble ones do not realize the nature of things with their supernormal powers and their fleshly eyes, but rather that they realize the nature of things with the noble wisdom, the noble vision, and the eye of noble insight.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar brtags pa de ltar ma lags na /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo dag gis dngos po'i rang bzhin ji ltar brtags pa de ltar ma lags na /
translated: It is not the case that the nature of things is as imagined by childish ordinary beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po khong du ma chud pa'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i ngo bo'i dngos po khong du ma chud pa'i phyir byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa ldog par 'gyur /
translated: how can the conceptualizations of childish ordinary beings be reversed if they do not understand the nature of things as it is?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de dag ni phyin ci log kyang ma lags /
analyzed: de dag ni phyin ci log kyang ma lags /

analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'ang ma lags so //

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

analyzed: 'phags pa'i dngos po'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin khong du ma chud pa dang / yod pa dang / med pa'i mtshan nyid las ldog pa mthong ba'i slad du'o //
translated: because they have not understood the nature of the reality of the noble ones, and because they see the reversal of the characteristics of existence and non-existence.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis dngos po ji ltar rnam par brtags pa'ang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la spyod yul ma lags pa'i phyir de bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis dngos po ji ltar rnam par brtags pa'ang rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul la spyod yul ma lags pa'i phyir de bzhin du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the way the noble ones conceptually distinguish things is not so, because it is not the domain of the objects of their own characteristics.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de dag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid de'ang sgyu ma bstan pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid snang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po'i rang bzhin dang / mtshan nyid de'ang sgyu ma bstan pas kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyid snang ngo //
translated: the nature and characteristics of those things also appear as the imagined nature through the teaching of illusions.

original: 'di ltar ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ste /
translated: It is like this:

analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid la lta bar ltung bas gzhan dag gi spyod yul du 'gyur te /
translated: because of falling into the view of the characteristics of things, they become the domain of others.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa'i @193a *//
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pa'i @193a *//
translated: because they have not understood the nature of the characteristics of things,

original: phyir de dag ji lta ba bzhin ma lags pas thugs pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir de dag ji lta ba bzhin ma lags pas thugs pa ma mchis par 'gyur ro //
translated: they are not as they are, and so they become without thought.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las skyes pa dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ma lags pa na /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu las skyes pa dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ma lags pa na /
translated: The nature of things is not the characteristic of the nature of things that arises from the cause of the imagined nature.

original: de ji ltar kun rtog pas so sor rnam par brtags pa ji lta bur brtags pa de bzhin du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar kun rtog pas so sor rnam par brtags pa ji lta bur brtags pa de bzhin du mi 'gyur /

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: so sor rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid kyang gzhan /

analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid kyang gzhan te /
translated: and the characteristic of the nature of things is another.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid rgyu mi mthun pa de dag byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis phan tshun du brtags na ji ltar de bzhin du mi 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid rgyu mi mthun pa de dag byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis phan tshun du brtags na ji ltar de bzhin du mi 'gyur /
translated: those causes of imagination and the characteristic of nature are not in agreement. When childish ordinary beings imagine them to be mutually in agreement, how could it be as it is?

analyzed: 'di ltar sems can rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa bzlog pa'i slad du ji ltar so sor rnam par rtog pas rnam par brtags pa de bzhin du med do zhes bgyi'am /
translated: In that case, in order to turn away the thoughts of sentient beings, would it be said, ‚ÄòIt is not as it is imagined by individual imagination‚Äô?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ci khyod kyis sems can rnams kyi yod pa dang / med par lta ba bzlog ste /
analyzed: ci khyod kyis sems can rnams kyi yod pa dang / med par lta ba bzlog ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDo you want me to stop sentient beings from the views of existence and nonexistence,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa dang / 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang yul la mngon par chags pas yod par lta ba la dgod dam; 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po bstan pas rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa ma mchis par bgyi 'am /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa dang / 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang yul la mngon par chags pas yod par lta ba la dgod dam; 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi dngos po bstan pas rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa ma mchis par bgyi 'am /
translated: and then establish them in the view of existence by attachment to the nature of things and attachment to the domain and object of the wisdom of the noble ones, or do you want me to make the teaching of the Dharma of complete isolation disappear by teaching the nature of things that is the essence of the wisdom of the noble ones?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: blo @193b gros chen po /
analyzed: blo @193b gros chen po /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati,

original: 'phags pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin bstan pas ngas rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa med par bya ba 'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin bstan pas ngas rab tu dben pa'i chos bstan pa med par bya ba 'ang ma yin /
translated: I do not make the teaching of the Dharma of complete isolation disappear by teaching the nature of things that is the essence of the wisdom of the noble ones,

original: yod par lta ba la dgod pa'ang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: yod par lta ba la dgod pa'ang ma yin gyi /
translated: nor do I establish them in the view of existence.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: ngas thog ma med pa'i dus nas dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa'i sems can rnams kyi skrag pa'i gnas yongs su spang ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa'i mtshan nyid du lta bas rab
analyzed: ngas thog ma med pa'i dus nas dngos po'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa'i sems can rnams kyi skrag pa'i gnas yongs su spang ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi dngos po'i rang bzhin la mngon par chags pa'i mtshan nyid du lta bas rab
translated: I have taught this in order to completely eliminate the fear of those sentient beings who are attached to the characteristics of the nature of things since beginningless time.üîΩ

original: tu dben pa'i chos bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: tu dben pa'i chos bstan par bya ste /
translated: I will teach the Dharma that is free from the view of the characteristics of the nature of things that is fixated upon by the pristine consciousness of the noble ones in order to completely eliminate the fear of sentient beings who have fixated on the characteristics of the nature of things since beginningless time.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: ngas dngos po'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i ma byas mod kyi /
analyzed: ngas dngos po'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i ma byas mod kyi /
translated: I have not taught the nature of things.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pas dben pa'i phyir la spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pas dben pa'i phyir la spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: in that way, by understanding the way things are just as they are, one will enter into the practice of solitude.

original: nor sel mtshams med par mthong bas rang gi sems snang ba tsam du zhugs shing phyi rol gyi snang ba dngos po dang / dngos po med pa las lta ba rnam par bzlog ste /
analyzed: nor sel mtshams med par mthong bas rang gi sems snang ba tsam du zhugs shing phyi rol gyi snang ba dngos po dang / dngos po med pa las lta ba rnam par bzlog ste /
translated: Having seen the Avƒ´ci hell, one enters into the mere appearances of one‚Äôs own mind and turns away from the view of external appearances, things, and nonthings.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa'i phyag rgyas shin tu btab cing yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po rnam par spangs pas dngos po'i rang bzhin rnams la so so rang gis rig pa'i blos mngon sum du
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa'i phyag rgyas shin tu btab cing yod pa dang med pa'i dngos po rnam par spangs pas dngos po'i rang bzhin rnams la so so rang gis rig pa'i blos mngon sum du
translated: The nature of things is directly perceived by the individual mind, which is sealed with the seal of perfect understanding of things as they are through the three doors of perfect liberation.üîΩ

original: gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the seal of perfect understanding of things as they are through the three gates of liberation, and by abandoning existent and nonexistent things, the nature of things will be directly perceived by the mind of individual self-awareness.

original: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang / blo gros chen po /
translated: ‚ÄúMoreover, MahƒÅmati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar mi @194a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar mi @194a *//
translated: bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas should not make the assertion, ‚ÄòAll phenomena are unborn.‚Äô

original: bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bya'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dam bca' ba'ang dngos po thams cad kyi nang du 'du ba dang / de'i rgyus 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bcas te smras na /
analyzed: dam bca' ba'ang dngos po thams cad kyi nang du 'du ba dang / de'i rgyus 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bcas te smras na /
translated: Because the assertion is included within all things, and because it has the characteristic of engaging with its cause, if one asserts and says, ‚ÄòAll things are unborn,‚Äô

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dam bcas pa las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dam bcas pa las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas will fall from their assertion.

original: dam bcas pa'ang de las ltos te 'byung bas na dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam gang bcas pa de'i dam bcas pa de'ang nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'ang de las ltos te 'byung bas na dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam gang bcas pa de'i dam bcas pa de'ang nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the thesis also arises in dependence on that, all things are unarisen.

original: de ste dam bcas pa de'ang chos thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir ma skyes pa na dam bcas pa'ang mtshan nyid tha mi dad de /
analyzed: de ste dam bcas pa de'ang chos thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir ma skyes pa na dam bcas pa'ang mtshan nyid tha mi dad de /
translated: But if that thesis is also unarisen because it is included among all phenomena, then the thesis is not different in character from them.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes par smra ba ni rab tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad ma skyes par smra ba ni rab tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is unarisen, the claim that all phenomena are unarisen is utterly undermined.

original: dam bcas pa'i yan lag gi rgyus dam bcas pa yod pa dang med pa las ma skyes so //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i yan lag gi rgyus dam bcas pa yod pa dang med pa las ma skyes so //
translated: Because of the reason that the thesis is a part of it, the thesis is not arisen from existence or nonexistence.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: dam bcas pa de'ang dngos po thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pas yod pa dang med pa las ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dam bcas pa de'ang dngos po thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pas yod pa dang med pa las ma skyes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: that thesis is included among all things, so it has the character of not being arisen from existence or nonexistence.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: gal te dam bcas pa ma skyes pa des dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar byed na /
analyzed: gal te dam bcas pa ma skyes pa des dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa'o zhes dam bca' bar byed na /
translated: if that unarisen thesis is used to make the claim that all things are unarisen,

original: de ltar na'ang dam bcas pa las nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na'ang dam bcas pa las nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: However, it would be a violation of your promise.

original: dam bcas pa'ang yod pa dang med pa las mi skye ba'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid las dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'ang yod pa dang med pa las mi skye ba'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid las dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, you should not make a promise based on the characteristics of things that are neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: blo gros chen @194b po; de dag gi dam bcas pa dang ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyis mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen @194b po; de dag gi dam bcas pa dang ma skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyis mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: MahƒÅmati, their promise is based on the characteristics of the unborn nature.

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,üîΩyou should not make a promise because it is flawed with many faults.

original: nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pa'i phyir khyod kyis dam bca' bar mi bya'o; ;yan lag rnams kyang phan tshun rgyur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang / byas pa'i phyir yan lag rnams dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags pa'i phyir khyod kyis dam bca' bar mi bya'o; ;yan lag rnams kyang phan tshun rgyur gyur pa'i mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba dang / byas pa'i phyir yan lag rnams dam bca' bar mi bya'o //
translated: MahƒÅmati, you should not make a promise about the parts because they have different characteristics as mutual causes and because they are created.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:üîΩAlthough bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas should not make a promise that all phenomena are unborn,

original: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / de bzhin du chos thams cad stong pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dam bca' bar mi bya mod kyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang / de bzhin du chos thams cad stong pa dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dam bca' bar mi bya mod kyi /
translated: and similarly, that all phenomena are empty and essenceless,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dngos po thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bur bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos dngos po thams cad sgyu ma dang rmi lam lta bur bstan par bya ste /
translated: bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas should teach that all things are like illusions and dreams.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: byis pa rnams yod pa dang med par ltung ba de dag skrag par mi 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po las ring du mi 'gyur bar byis pa rnams kyis skrag pa'i gnas spang ba'i phyir snang ba dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: byis pa rnams yod pa dang med par ltung ba de dag skrag par mi 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po las ring du mi 'gyur bar byis pa rnams kyis skrag pa'i gnas spang ba'i phyir snang ba dang mi snang ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: in order to avoid frightening the childish who would fall into views of existence and nonexistence, and in order to prevent them from straying far from the MahƒÅyƒÅna, the childish should be taught that all phenomena are like illusions and dreams, in order to abandon the basis of their fear.üîΩBecause they deceive the mind with views and appearances,

original: lta ba dang / blo slu bar byed pa'i phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam lta bur bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang / blo slu bar byed pa'i phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma dang / rmi lam lta bur bstan par bya'o //
translated: and because they deceive the mind with views and appearances, all phenomena should be taught to be like illusions and dreams.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: rang bzhin med cing rnam rig med //
analyzed: rang bzhin med cing rnam rig med //
translated: Without nature, without cognition,

original: dngos po med cing kun gzhi med //
analyzed: dngos po med cing kun gzhi med //
translated: Without things, without foundation,

original: 'di dag ro bzhin byis pa yi //
analyzed: 'di dag ro bzhin byis pa yi //

original: log pa'i rtog pa can gyis brtags //
analyzed: log pa'i rtog pa can gyis brtags //

original: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes par //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes par //
translated: All phenomena are unborn,

original: mu stegs kun las bsgrag @195a *//
analyzed: mu stegs kun las bsgrag @195a *//
translated: In order to proclaim it to all the tƒ´rthikas,

original: pa'i phyir // dngos po rkyen dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: pa'i phyir // dngos po rkyen dang ldan pa ni //
translated: Things that possess conditions

original: su la'ang skyes pa yong med do //
analyzed: su la'ang skyes pa yong med do //
translated: Are not produced for anyone at all.

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes par //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes par //
translated: All things are unproduced,

original: dam bca' ba la mi rtag ste //
analyzed: dam bca' ba la mi rtag ste //
translated: And the thesis is not impermanent.

original: de 'grub de rgyu ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de 'grub de rgyu ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is established by the cause of that,

original: de dag blo yang nyams par 'gyur //üîΩji ltar log par skra shad 'dzings //
analyzed: de dag blo yang nyams par 'gyur // ji ltar log par skra shad 'dzings //
translated: They will also lose their minds.üîΩJust as the one with eye disease sees

original: skye bo rab rib can gyis mthong //
analyzed: skye bo rab rib can gyis mthong //
translated: The floating hair of false conjunction,

original: de bzhin dngos por rnam rtog 'di //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos por rnam rtog 'di //
translated: So too this conception of things

original: log par byis pas rnam par brtags //
analyzed: log par byis pas rnam par brtags //
translated: Is falsely imagined by the childish.

original: srid pa gsum ni brtags pa tsam //
analyzed: srid pa gsum ni brtags pa tsam //
translated: The three existences are mere imputation;

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yong med de //üîΩbrtags pa dngos po'i rang bzhin du //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yong med de // brtags pa dngos po'i rang bzhin du //
translated: The nature of things does not exist at all.üîΩThe imputations are imagined

original: rtog pa can rnams rtog par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtog pa can rnams rtog par 'gyur //
translated: By the conceptualizers as the nature of things.üîΩFrom the consciousness of characteristics and things

original: mtshan dang dngos po'i rnam rig dang // yid kyi rnam par g-yos pa las //
analyzed: mtshan dang dngos po'i rnam rig dang // yid kyi rnam par g-yos pa las //
translated: And the movements of the mind,

original: nga yi sras rnams 'das nas ni //
analyzed: nga yi sras rnams 'das nas ni //
translated: My sons, after passing beyond,

original: de dag rnam par mi rtog spyod //
analyzed: de dag rnam par mi rtog spyod //
translated: Will practice without conceptualization.

original: smig rgyu pa la ji lta bur //
analyzed: smig rgyu pa la ji lta bur //
translated: Just as in a mirage

original: chu med pa la chu 'dzin pa //
analyzed: chu med pa la chu 'dzin pa //
translated: In the absence of water, there is the apprehension of water.

original: snang la byis pa de bzhin te //
analyzed: snang la byis pa de bzhin te //
translated: The childish are like that,

original: 'phags pa rnams ni khyad par ldan //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams ni khyad par ldan //
translated: But the noble ones are different.

original: 'phags pa'i mthong ba dag pa ste //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i mthong ba dag pa ste //
translated: The noble ones‚Äô vision is pure,

original: rnam par thar pa gsum la skyes //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum la skyes //
translated: Arisen from the three liberations.

original: skye dang 'jig las rnam grol te //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig las rnam grol te //
translated: Liberated from arising and destruction,

original: snang ba med la rab tu spyod //
analyzed: snang ba med la rab tu spyod //
translated: They practice in the absence of appearances.

original: dngos po rnams ni snang ba med de //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni snang ba med de //
translated: Things are not without appearances,

original: rnal 'byor can la'ang med pa'ang min //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can la'ang med pa'ang min //

original: dngos dang dngos med mnyam pas ni //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med mnyam pas ni //

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skye //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi 'bras bu skye //
translated: The fruits of the noble ones arise.üîΩHow are things and nonthings

original: ji ltar dngos po dngos med dang // mnyam pa nyid du ji ltar byed //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po dngos med dang // mnyam pa nyid du ji ltar byed //
translated: Made equal?

original: phyi dang nang gi g-yo ba @195b rnams //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi g-yo ba @195b rnams //
translated: When the movements of the outer and inner

original: nam zhig sems kyis mi shes na //
analyzed: nam zhig sems kyis mi shes na //
translated: Are not known by the mind,

original: de na 'jig par byed pa ste //
analyzed: de na 'jig par byed pa ste //
translated: Then there is destruction,

original: sems kyi mnyam pa nyid kyang mthong //
analyzed: sems kyi mnyam pa nyid kyang mthong //
translated: And the equality of the mind is seen.

original: blo gros chen pos gsol ba /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol ba /
translated: MahƒÅmati said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du nam dmigs par bya ba'i don shes pas mi dmigs pa de na rnam par rig pa tsam du gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du nam dmigs par bya ba'i don shes pas mi dmigs pa de na rnam par rig pa tsam du gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄúWhen the object of perception is known, it is not perceived. At that time, it is posited as mere awareness.

original: rnam par rig pa'i gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa'ang 'dzin pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa'ang 'dzin pa med pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no apprehended object of awareness, there is also no apprehender.

original: de 'dzin pa med pas rnam par rtog pa zhes bsgrags pa'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi 'jug go zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa med pas rnam par rtog pa zhes bsgrags pa'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi 'jug go zhes gsungs na /
translated: Since there is no apprehender, the consciousness that is proclaimed as conceptualization also does not operate.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das /üîΩdngos po rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs tha mi dad par khong du ma chud pa'i phyir shes pas mi dmigs sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / dngos po rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs tha mi dad par khong du ma chud pa'i phyir shes pas mi dmigs sam /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,üîΩis it because of not comprehending the various specific and general characteristics of things that consciousness does not perceive them?

original: 'on te rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid zil du brlag pa'i phyir shes pas mi dmigs sam /
analyzed: 'on te rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid zil du brlag pa'i phyir shes pas mi dmigs sam /
translated: Or is it because of the destruction of the nature of things with various specific and general characteristics that consciousness does not perceive them?

original: de ste rtsig pa dang / re lde dang / rdzing dang / ra ba dang / sa dang / chu dang / rlung dang / mes chod pa rnams dang / rgyang ring po dang / nye ba'i phyir shes bya'i don shes pas mi dmigs sam /
analyzed: de ste rtsig pa dang / re lde dang / rdzing dang / ra ba dang / sa dang / chu dang / rlung dang / mes chod pa rnams dang / rgyang ring po dang / nye ba'i phyir shes bya'i don shes pas mi dmigs sam /
translated: Is it because the object of cognition is obstructed by a wall, a fence, a rampart, the earth, water, fire, or wind, or by distance or nearness, that it is not perceived?

original: de ste long ba dang / byis pa dang / rgan po'i dbang po dang ldan pas shes bya'i don mi dmigs /
analyzed: de ste long ba dang / byis pa dang / rgan po'i dbang po dang ldan pas shes bya'i don mi dmigs /
translated: Or is it because the object of cognition is not perceived by the sense organs of the blind, the young, or the aged?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de gal te rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs tha mi dad pa khong du ma chud pa'i phyir shes pas mi dmigs na ni /
analyzed: de gal te rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs tha mi dad pa khong du ma chud pa'i phyir shes pas mi dmigs na ni /
translated: if it is because of not understanding the various specific and general characteristics that the object of cognition is not perceived,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes pa zhes kyang mi bgyi @196a *//
analyzed: shes pa zhes kyang mi bgyi @196a *//
translated: it should not be called cognition.

original: ste; gang don yod pa mi dmigs pa de ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ste; gang don yod pa mi dmigs pa de ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: That which does not perceive an existent object is not cognition.

original: de ste rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid zil du brlag pa'i phyir shes pas mi dmigs na ni /
analyzed: de ste rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid zil du brlag pa'i phyir shes pas mi dmigs na ni /
translated: If it is because the essence of the various specific and general characteristics is overwhelmed that the object of cognition is not perceived,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de'ang mi shes pa ste shes pa ma lags so //
analyzed: de'ang mi shes pa ste shes pa ma lags so //
translated: That is not knowledge, it is not knowing.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes bya yod na shes pa 'byung gi med pa las ma lags te /
analyzed: shes bya yod na shes pa 'byung gi med pa las ma lags te /
translated: if there is an object of knowledge, knowledge arises, not from the non-existent.

original: de dang ldan pas na shes bya shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas na shes bya shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of possessing that, it is called 'knowledge of the object of knowledge'.

original: de ste rtsig pa dang / re lde dang / rdzing dang / ra ba dang / sa dang / chu dang / rlung dang / mes chod pa rnams dang / rgyang ring po dang / nye ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / phyis pa dang /
analyzed: de ste rtsig pa dang / re lde dang / rdzing dang / ra ba dang / sa dang / chu dang / rlung dang / mes chod pa rnams dang / rgyang ring po dang / nye ba'i phyir mi dmigs pa dang / phyis pa dang /
translated: If it is not perceived due to being obstructed by walls, fences, ponds, moats, earth, water, wind, or fire, or due to being far away or near,

original: rgan po dang / long bar gyur bas dbang po rnams ma tshang ba'i phyir shes pas mi dmigs na ni /
analyzed: rgan po dang / long bar gyur bas dbang po rnams ma tshang ba'i phyir shes pas mi dmigs na ni /
translated: or if it is not perceived by knowledge due to being old, blind, or having incomplete faculties,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: blo ma tshang ba'i phyir yod pa'i don mi dmigs te /
analyzed: blo ma tshang ba'i phyir yod pa'i don mi dmigs te /
translated: it is not perceived due to the incompleteness of the mind,

original: de ni shes pa ma lags kyi mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni shes pa ma lags kyi mi shes pa'o //
translated: that is not knowledge, it is not knowing.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: blo gros chen po; de ni de ltar na mi shes pa ma yin te shes pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po; de ni de ltar na mi shes pa ma yin te shes pa'o //
translated: MahƒÅmati, it is not so, it is not not knowing, it is knowing.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: ngas de la dgongs te nam mi dmigs pa'i don shes pas mi dmigs pa de ni rnam par rig pa tsam du gzhag pa yin no zhes ma bshad de /
analyzed: ngas de la dgongs te nam mi dmigs pa'i don shes pas mi dmigs pa de ni rnam par rig pa tsam du gzhag pa yin no zhes ma bshad de /
translated: I do not explain that non-apprehension is posited as mere representation-only because of understanding the meaning of non-apprehension in that way.

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa dang / yod pa dang med pa las phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med pa'i phyir shes pas @196b don ma dmigs so //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa dang / yod pa dang med pa las phyi rol gyi dngos po dngos po med pa'i phyir shes pas @196b don ma dmigs so //
translated: Because of the non-existence of external things, the cognizer does not apprehend objects.

original: de mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes bya dang shes pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i phyir shes bya dang shes pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of the non-apprehension of those, the cognized and cognition do not occur.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum ma rjes su rtogs pas shes pa'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum ma rjes su rtogs pas shes pa'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: Because of the non-realization of the three doors of liberation, cognition is also not apprehended.

original: rtog pa can thog ma med pa'i dus nas dngos po dang dngos po med par spros pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i blo can rnams kyis ni de ltar mi shes so //
analyzed: rtog pa can thog ma med pa'i dus nas dngos po dang dngos po med par spros pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i blo can rnams kyis ni de ltar mi shes so //
translated: Those who are conceptual, whose minds are stained by the habitual tendencies of the conceptual elaborations of existence and non-existence since beginningless time, do not understand in that way.

original: de dag mi shes pas phyi rol gyi rdzas dang / dbyibs dang mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med do zhes byas nas rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba ni sems tsam du ston to //
analyzed: de dag mi shes pas phyi rol gyi rdzas dang / dbyibs dang mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med do zhes byas nas rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba ni sems tsam du ston to //
translated: Not knowing that, they say, ‚ÄúExternal things do not exist as substances, shapes, or characteristics.‚Äù The non-occurrence of conceptualization is shown to be mind only.

original: bdag dang bdag gi mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa la mngon par chags shing zhen pa rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pas shes pa dang shes bya so sor rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi mtshan nyid du 'dzin pa la mngon par chags shing zhen pa rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pas shes pa dang shes bya so sor rnam par rtog ste /
translated: Those who are attached to and cling to the characteristics of ‚Äúself‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù who have not understood that [external] things are mere appearances of their own minds, conceive of consciousness and objects as separate.

original: de dag shes pa dang shes byar so sor rnam par rtog pas phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa mi dmigs pas chad par lta ba la rab tu rten to //
analyzed: de dag shes pa dang shes byar so sor rnam par rtog pas phyi rol gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa mi dmigs pas chad par lta ba la rab tu rten to //
translated: Because they conceive of consciousness and objects as separate, they do not observe the differentiation of external things and non-things. Thus, they rely on the view of annihilation.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: de ste dmigs bya yod bzhin du //
analyzed: de ste dmigs bya yod bzhin du //
translated: If, while the object of perception exists,

original: shes pas mthong bar mi 'gyur na //
analyzed: shes pas mthong bar mi 'gyur na //
translated: consciousness does not see it,

original: de ni shes min mi shes pa //
analyzed: de ni shes min mi shes pa //
translated: that [object] is neither consciousness nor non-consciousness.

original: de dag rtog can rnams kyi tshul //
analyzed: de dag rtog can rnams kyi tshul //
translated: This is the way of those with conceptual thoughts.

original: gzhan min mtshan nyid med pa dang // chod pa dang ni nye ring phyir //
analyzed: gzhan min mtshan nyid med pa dang // chod pa dang ni nye ring phyir //
translated: Is obstructed, and is distant or near.

original: de ste shes pas mi mthong na //
analyzed: de ste shes pas mi mthong na //
translated: If consciousness does not see,

original: de ni log pa'i shes zhes bya //
analyzed: de ni log pa'i shes zhes bya //
translated: It is called a false consciousness.

original: byis pa rgan po ldongs gyur pa //
analyzed: byis pa rgan po ldongs gyur pa //
translated: The childish, the aged, and the blind

original: shes bya de yang yod bzhin du //
analyzed: shes bya de yang yod bzhin du //
translated: Also, though the object of cognition exists,

original: gal te shes pa mi skye na //
analyzed: gal te shes pa mi skye na //
translated: If consciousness does not arise,

original: de yang log pa'i shes zhes @197a *//
analyzed: de yang log pa'i shes zhes @197a *//
translated: That is also called a false consciousness.

original: bya; ;gzhan yang /
analyzed: bya; ;gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa lus kyi gnas ngan len rang gi so sor rnam par rtog p'a gar thabs su gar byed cing /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa lus kyi gnas ngan len rang gi so sor rnam par rtog p'a gar thabs su gar byed cing /
translated: the childish ordinary beings, through the dance of their own individual conceptions of the physical body's negative tendencies from beginningless time,

original: rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul bstan pa la mi mkhas te /
analyzed: rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul bstan pa la mi mkhas te /
translated: are unskilled in demonstrating their own philosophical tenets.

original: rang gi sems snang ba phyi rol gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid du mngon par chags pas thabs su bstan pa brjod pa la mngon par chags te /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba phyi rol gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid du mngon par chags pas thabs su bstan pa brjod pa la mngon par chags te /
translated: Attached to the characteristics of external things that appear as their own minds, they are attached to the teachings expressed through skillful means.

original: mtha' bzhi'i tshul rnam par dag pa rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul la ni rab tu mi sgom mo //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi'i tshul rnam par dag pa rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i tshul la ni rab tu mi sgom mo //
translated: They do not meditate on the pure way of our philosophical system, which is the way of the four extremes.üîΩMahƒÅmati said:

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‚ÄúBlessed One,

original: de de bzhin te /

translated: they do not attain nirvƒÅ·πáa due to the view of annihilation.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

analyzed: gzhan dag ni yul la rnam par rtog pa zad pas mda'i shugs zad pa bzhin du yul gzhan gyi gnas su song na thar pa'o zhes brjod do //

translated: Some conceive of nirvƒÅ·πáa as the internal and external phenomena being fully understood, and as the non-disintegration of past, future, and present things.

analyzed: kha cig ni 'jig rten rnams ni dbang pos rang dbang du byas par mthong bas mya ngan las 'das par rtog go /

translated: Like the vivid colors of a peacock, the many sources of jewels, and sharp thorns, seeing the nature of things leads to nirvana.üîΩ

translated: They are eliminated by the realization of the individual no-self, the realization of the two types of selflessness, the reversal of the two types of afflictions, the purification of the two obscurations, and the attainment of the tathƒÅgatas‚Äô stage by means of the meditative absorption of illusion-like images.

original: blo gros chen po /

original: blo gros chen po /

original: blo gros chen po /

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva MahƒÅmati addressed the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /üîΩgang gis bdag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid la mkhas pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / gang gis bdag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid la mkhas pas /
translated: Blessed One,üîΩplease explain to me the self-awakening of the Buddha, the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, by which I and other bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas, through skill in the essence of the TathƒÅgata,

original: bdag nyid kyang gzhan rnams kyang khong du chud par bgyi ba'i sangs rgyas kyi rang gi sangs rgyas pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bdag la bshad du gsol /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang gzhan rnams kyang khong du chud par bgyi ba'i sangs rgyas kyi rang gi sangs rgyas pa nyid de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bdag la bshad du gsol /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: de'i phyir khyod nyid kyis dris shig dang / ji ltar khyod kyis bzod pa de bzhin du ngas lan sbyin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyod nyid kyis dris shig dang / ji ltar khyod kyis bzod pa de bzhin du ngas lan sbyin no //
translated: therefore, ask whatever you wish, and I will answer you according to your understanding.üîΩMahƒÅmati said:

original: blo gros chen pos gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: blo gros chen pos gsol pa; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byas pa'am /üîΩma byas pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byas pa'am / ma byas pa'am /
translated: The TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One,üîΩwhether he has performed actions or not,

original: rgyu 'am / 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: rgyu 'am / 'bras bu'am /
translated: the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha is a cause or an effect,

original: mtshan @208a *// nam; mtshan gyi gzhi'am /
analyzed: mtshan @208a *// nam; mtshan gyi gzhi'am /

original: brjod pa'am / brjod par bya ba 'am /
analyzed: brjod pa'am / brjod par bya ba 'am /

original: blo 'am / rig par bya ba'am /
analyzed: blo 'am / rig par bya ba'am /
translated: an awareness or something to be known.

original: bcom ldan 'das /üîΩde lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig gi nges pa'i sgra ni gcig gam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig gi nges pa'i sgra ni gcig gam /
translated: Blessed One,

original: tha dad dam ci lags /
analyzed: tha dad dam ci lags /
translated: are such terms as these the same or different?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig gi nges pa'i sgrar byas pa'ang ma yin /üîΩma byas pa'ang ma yin /üîΩrgyu'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig gi nges pa'i sgrar byas pa'ang ma yin / ma byas pa'ang ma yin / rgyu'ang ma yin /
translated: the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha is neither a cause nor an effect,üîΩnor is he a characteristic or a basis of characteristics.

original: 'bras bu'ang ma yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang ma yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnyis ka yang nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because both would be faulty.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa yin na ni mi rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa byas pa yin na ni mi rtag par 'gyur te /

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir 'bras bu'o cag kyang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir 'bras bu'o cag kyang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bas na /
translated: And because of impermanence, all of us would become TathƒÅgatas.

original: de ni nga dang de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan dag gis de ltar ma dgongs so //
analyzed: de ni nga dang de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan dag gis de ltar ma dgongs so //
translated: But that is not how it is intended by me or by other TathƒÅgatas.

original: de ste ma byas pa yin na ni bdag nyid du ma red pas na /
analyzed: de ste ma byas pa yin na ni bdag nyid du ma red pas na /
translated: If he were not a product, he would not be a self.

original: tshogs yang dag par bsgrub pa'ang don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshogs yang dag par bsgrub pa'ang don med par 'gyur te /
translated: And the correct practice of the accumulations would be pointless.

original: ma byas pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva dang / mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva dang / mo gsham gyi bu dang mtshungs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he would not be a product, he would be like the horns of a rabbit or the son of a barren woman.

original: blo gros chen po /üîΩgang rgyu'ang ma yin /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / gang rgyu'ang ma yin /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: 'bras bu'ang ma yin pa de ni yod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang ma yin pa de ni yod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: that which is neither a cause nor an effect does not exist

original: med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: and is not nonexistent.

original: gang yod pa'ang @208b ma yin /
analyzed: gang yod pa'ang @208b ma yin /
translated: That which is neither existent

original: med pa'ang ma yin pa de ni mtha' bzhi'i phyi rol to //
analyzed: med pa'ang ma yin pa de ni mtha' bzhi'i phyi rol to //
translated: nor nonexistent is beyond the four extremes.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: mtha' bzhi ni 'jig rten gyi spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: mtha' bzhi ni 'jig rten gyi spyod pa yin te /
translated: the four extremes are the conduct of the world.

original: gang mtha' bzhi'i phyi rol de ni mo gsham gyi bu ltar tshig tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang mtha' bzhi'i phyi rol de ni mo gsham gyi bu ltar tshig tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is outside of the four extremes is mere words, like the son of a barren woman.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: mo gsham gyi bu ni tshig tsam ste mtha' bzhir lhung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu ni tshig tsam ste mtha' bzhir lhung ba ma yin no //
translated: the son of a barren woman is mere words, not falling into the four extremes.

original: ma lhung bas na mkhas pa rnams la tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: ma lhung bas na mkhas pa rnams la tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Not falling, it is not a valid cognition for the wise.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshig gi don rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi tshig gi don rig par bya'o //
translated: The wise should understand the meaning of the words of all TathƒÅgatas in this way.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang yang ngas chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bshad pa de'i don kyang khong du chud par gyis shig /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis gang yang ngas chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bshad pa de'i don kyang khong du chud par gyis shig /
translated: the wise should also understand the meaning of what I have explained, that all phenomena are without self.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: bdag med pa'i dngos po ni bdag med pa nyid de /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i dngos po ni bdag med pa nyid de /
translated: the non-existence of self is itself the absence of self.

original: rta dang ba lang bzhin du chos thams cad ni bdag gi dngos por yod de /
analyzed: rta dang ba lang bzhin du chos thams cad ni bdag gi dngos por yod de /

original: gzhan gyi dngos por med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos por med do //
translated: but not as the entity of another.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: ba lang gi dngos po ni rta'i bdag nyid ma yin /
analyzed: ba lang gi dngos po ni rta'i bdag nyid ma yin /
translated: the entity of an ox is not the self of a horse,

original: rta'i dngos po ni ba lang gi bdag nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rta'i dngos po ni ba lang gi bdag nyid ma yin te /
translated: The entity of a horse is not the self of an ox.

original: de ni yod de med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni yod de med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: It exists, and it is not nonexistent.

original: de gnyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid du med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid du med pa ma yin te /
translated: Those two are not nonexistent as their own characteristics,

original: de gnyis rang gi mtshan nyid du yod do //
analyzed: de gnyis rang gi mtshan nyid du yod do //
translated: because those two exist as their own characteristics.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid du'ang med pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid du'ang med pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: all phenomena are not nonexistent as their own characteristics,

original: de dag ni yod do //
analyzed: de dag ni yod do //
translated: because they exist.

original: de bas na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa bzung nas /
analyzed: de bas na byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis rnam par rtog pa bzung nas /
translated: Therefore, childish ordinary beings, having taken up conceptualization,

original: bdag med par khong du chud de /üîΩrnam par mi @209a *//
analyzed: bdag med par khong du chud de / rnam par mi @209a *//
translated: understand selflessness,üîΩbut not

original: rtog pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtog pas ni ma yin no //
translated: nonconceptually.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / skye ba med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang / skye ba med pa dang / ngo bo nyid med par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, all phenomena should be known to be emptiness, nonarising, and essenceless.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: In the same way, the TathƒÅgata is not the same as the aggregates,

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: nor is he different.

original: gal te phung po rnams dang gcig pa ma yin na ni phung po rnams byas pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ro; ;de ste tha dad na ni gnyis yod na gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams dang gcig pa ma yin na ni phung po rnams byas pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ro; ;de ste tha dad na ni gnyis yod na gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not identical with the aggregates, it would be impermanent, because the aggregates are produced.

original: ba lang gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi rva bzhin no //
translated: If it were different, it would be a duality, like the horn of a cow.

original: de la dngos po thams cad ni 'dra bas tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dngos po thams cad ni 'dra bas tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: But in this case, all things are not different, because they are similar.

original: ring po'i bye brag mthong bas tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ring po'i bye brag mthong bas tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not different because of the perception of the difference of length.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahamati,

original: ba lang gi rva g-yas pa las ni g-yon pa gzhan /
analyzed: ba lang gi rva g-yas pa las ni g-yon pa gzhan /
translated: the right horn of a cow is different from the left,

original: g-yon pa las kyang g-yas pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: g-yon pa las kyang g-yas pa gzhan yin te /
translated: and the left is different from the right.

original: de bzhin du ring po dang thung ngu'ang phan tshun du'o; ;de bzhin du kha dog sna tshogs kyang phan tshun tha dad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ring po dang thung ngu'ang phan tshun du'o; ;de bzhin du kha dog sna tshogs kyang phan tshun tha dad do //
translated: In the same way, long and short are different from each other, and so are the various colors different from each other.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams dang tha dad pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams dang tha dad pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: The Tathagata is not different from the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de bzhin du thar pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'ang tha dad pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du thar pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'ang tha dad pa'ang ma yin /
translated: In the same way, liberation and the Tathagata are not different,üîΩand yet they are not non-different.

original: gcig pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the same,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thar pa'i sgras bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid thar pa'i sgras bstan to //
translated: because the Thus-Gone One is taught by the word ‚Äúliberation.‚Äù

original: de ste thar pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa tha dad pa ni gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ste thar pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa tha dad pa ni gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: If liberation and the Thus-Gone One were different, they would possess the characteristics of form.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they would possess the characteristics of form, they would be impermanent.

original: de ste gcig na ni rnal 'byor @209b can rnams kyi thob pa'i mtshan nyid bye brag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ste gcig na ni rnal 'byor @209b can rnams kyi thob pa'i mtshan nyid bye brag med par 'gyur te /
translated: If they were the same, the characteristics of attainment by practitioners would be undifferentiated.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: rnal 'byor can rnams kyis ni bye brag kyang mthong bas na de'i phyir gcig pa'ang ma yin /üîΩtha dad pa'ang ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du shes pa dang / shes bya'ang gcig pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rnal 'byor can rnams kyis ni bye brag kyang mthong bas na de'i phyir gcig pa'ang ma yin / tha dad pa'ang ma yin no // de bzhin du shes pa dang / shes bya'ang gcig pa'ang ma yin /
translated: since practitioners see differentiation, therefore they are not the same and not different.

original: tha dad pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, cognition and the cognized are not the same and not different.

original: blo gros chen po /üîΩgang rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: blo gros chen po / gang rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: MahƒÅmati,üîΩthey are not permanent

original: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: and not impermanent,

original: rgyu'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rgyu'ang ma yin /
translated: not a cause

original: 'bras bu'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang ma yin /
translated: and not a result,üîΩnot conditioned

original: 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyang ma yin /
translated: and not unconditioned.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin /üîΩblo'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang ma yin / blo'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not unconditioned.üîΩIt is not the intellect.

original: rig par bya ba'ang ma yin /üîΩmtshan kyang ma yin /
analyzed: rig par bya ba'ang ma yin / mtshan kyang ma yin /
translated: It is not an object of cognition.üîΩIt is not a characteristic.

original: mtshan gyi gzhi'ang ma yin /üîΩphung po rnams kyang ma yin /
analyzed: mtshan gyi gzhi'ang ma yin / phung po rnams kyang ma yin /
translated: It is not the basis of a characteristic.üîΩIt is not the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams tha dad pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: phung po rnams tha dad pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not separate from the aggregates.

original: smra ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: smra ba'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not speech.

original: smra bar bya ba'ang ma yin /
analyzed: smra bar bya ba'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not an object of speech.

original: gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / ma 'brel ba de ni tshad ma thams cad las rnam par log pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin pa dang / ma 'brel ba de ni tshad ma thams cad las rnam par log pa'o //
translated: It is not one, not different, not both, not neither, and not unrelated. It is the complete opposite of all valid cognitions.

original: gang tshad ma thams cad las rnam par log pa de ni tshig tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang tshad ma thams cad las rnam par log pa de ni tshig tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever is the complete opposite of all valid cognitions is mere words.

original: gang tshig tam de ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gang tshig tam de ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: Whatever is mere words is unborn.

original: gang ma skyes pa de ni ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa de ni ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: Whatever is unborn is unceasing.

original: gang ma 'gags pa de ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gang ma 'gags pa de ni nam mkha' dang mtshungs so //
translated: Whatever is unceasing is similar to space.

original: blo gros chen po; nam mkha' ni rgyu'ang ma yin /
analyzed: blo gros chen po; nam mkha' ni rgyu'ang ma yin /
translated: MahƒÅmati, space is not a cause,

original: 'bras bu'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it an effect.

original: gang rgyu'ang ma yin pa /
analyzed: gang rgyu'ang ma yin pa /
translated: Whatever is not a cause

original: 'bras bu'ang ma yin pa de ni dmigs pa med pa'o //üîΩgang dmigs pa med pa de ni spros pa thams @210a *//
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang ma yin pa de ni dmigs pa med pa'o // gang dmigs pa med pa de ni spros pa thams @210a *//
translated: That which is neither a cause nor an effect is non-apprehensible.

original: cad las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: cad las 'das pa'o //
translated: That which is non-apprehensible is beyond all conceptual elaboration.

original: gang spros pa thams cad las 'das pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang spros pa thams cad las 'das pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin te /
translated: That which is beyond all conceptual elaboration is the TathƒÅgata.

original: de ni / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de ni / blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa nyid do //
translated: that is perfect buddhahood itself.

original: de ni sangs rgyas pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas pa nyid de /
translated: That is buddhahood itself,

original: tshad ma dang / dbang po thams cad las rnam par bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang / dbang po thams cad las rnam par bzlog pa'o //
translated: the complete reversal of all valid cognitions and sense faculties.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: tshad dang dbang po rnam par log /
analyzed: tshad dang dbang po rnam par log /
translated: Reversing valid cognitions and sense faculties,

original: 'bras bu ma yin rgyu yang min //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin rgyu yang min //
translated: not a result, not a cause,

original: blo dang rig par bya ba med //
analyzed: blo dang rig par bya ba med //
translated: no mind, no object of cognition,

original: mtshan dang mtshan gyi gzhi yang spangs //
analyzed: mtshan dang mtshan gyi gzhi yang spangs //
translated: abandoned are characteristics and the basis of characteristics.

original: phung por brten nas sangs rgyas pa //üîΩgang na'ang sus kyang ma mthong ste //
analyzed: phung por brten nas sangs rgyas pa // gang na'ang sus kyang ma mthong ste //
translated: The buddhahood based on the aggregatesüîΩis not seen by anyone anywhere.

original: gang na sus kyang ma mthong ba //
analyzed: gang na sus kyang ma mthong ba //
translated: Where it is not seen by anyone,

original: de la ji ltar rnam par sgom //
analyzed: de la ji ltar rnam par sgom //
translated: how can it be cultivated?

original: byas pa ma yin ma byas min //
analyzed: byas pa ma yin ma byas min //
translated: It is not produced, not non-produced,

original: 'bras bu ma yin rgyu yang min //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma yin rgyu yang min //
translated: It is neither a result nor a cause.üîΩIt is not the aggregates, nor is it other than the aggregates,

analyzed: chen po / mu stegs byed rnams kyi ni dngos po'i rang bzhin ma skyes pa /
