translated: It engages and ceases.

original: 'di ni brtags pa tsam nyid de //
analyzed: 'di ni brtags pa tsam nyid de //
translated: This is mere imputation,

original: phan tshun ltos pa 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa 'brel pa'o //
translated: The connection of mutual dependence.

original: rkyen rnams 'brel las logs shig na //
analyzed: rkyen rnams 'brel las logs shig na //
translated: Apart from the connection of conditions,

original: bskyed par bya ba'i don med do //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i don med do //
translated: The object to be produced does not exist.

original: bskyed pa med pas skye ba med //
analyzed: bskyed pa med pas skye ba med //
translated: Since there is no production, there is no arising.

original: mu stegs can gyi skyon gyis spangs //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi skyon gyis spangs //
translated: It is abandoned due to the fault of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: 'brel pa tsam du ngas bshad de //
analyzed: 'brel pa tsam du ngas bshad de //
translated: I explain it as mere connection,

original: byis pa rnams kyis mi rig go /
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis mi rig go /
translated: But the childish do not understand.

original: gang na 'brel las logs shig na //
analyzed: gang na 'brel las logs shig na //
translated: Apart from the connection,

original: dngos po bskyed pa yod ces pa //
analyzed: dngos po bskyed pa yod ces pa //
translated: ‚ÄúThings are produced‚Äù is said,

original: 'brel pa rnam par 'jig pa ste //
analyzed: 'brel pa rnam par 'jig pa ste //
translated: But this is the destruction of relations.

original: rgyu med smra bar shes par bya //üîΩgang na 'brel las logs shig na //
analyzed: rgyu med smra bar shes par bya // gang na 'brel las logs shig na //
translated: It should be understood as the teaching of causelessness.üîΩIf things existed separately

original: dngos po su la yod na ni //
analyzed: dngos po su la yod na ni //
translated: From relations,

original: mar me bzhin du rdzas rigs rnams //
analyzed: mar me bzhin du rdzas rigs rnams //
translated: Then, like a lamp, the substances and types

original: 'brel pa snang bar byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'brel pa snang bar byed par 'gyur //
translated: Would illuminate their relations.üîΩIf things existed separately

original: 'brel pa dag las logs shig tu //
analyzed: 'brel pa dag las logs shig tu //
translated: From relations,

original: @218b chos gang mi mkhas rtog pa ni //
analyzed: @218b chos gang mi mkhas rtog pa ni //
translated: Then the unwise would conceive of them.

original: ma skyes ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: ma skyes ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: But they are not produced, they are essenceless,

original: rang bzhin nam mkha' lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin nam mkha' lta bu'o //
translated: And their nature is like space.

original: 'phags pas thob pa'i chos nyid ni //
analyzed: 'phags pas thob pa'i chos nyid ni //
translated: The reality attained by the ƒÅryas

original: skye ba med pa gzhan yin te //
analyzed: skye ba med pa gzhan yin te //
translated: Is a different kind of non-production.

original: gang de'i skye ba mi 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang de'i skye ba mi 'byung ba //
translated: When production does not occur,

original: de ni mi skye bzod pa yin //
analyzed: de ni mi skye bzod pa yin //
translated: That is the acceptance of non-production.

original: nam zhig 'jig rten 'di dag kun //
analyzed: nam zhig 'jig rten 'di dag kun //
translated: When one sees that all these worlds

original: 'di ni 'brel pa tsam mo zhes //
analyzed: 'di ni 'brel pa tsam mo zhes //
translated: Are merely relations,

original: 'brel pa nyid du mthong ba na //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid du mthong ba na //
translated: Then one sees them as relations,

original: de na sems kyang mnyam par 'jog /
analyzed: de na sems kyang mnyam par 'jog /
translated: And at that time the mind is concentrated.

original: mi shes sred pa las la sogs //
analyzed: mi shes sred pa las la sogs //
translated: Ignorance, craving, action, and so on

original: 'brel pa dag ni nang gi yin //
analyzed: 'brel pa dag ni nang gi yin //
translated: Are the internal relations.

original: 'khor lo chu shing 'jig la sogs //
analyzed: 'khor lo chu shing 'jig la sogs //
translated: The wheel, the plantain, the mirage, and so on.

original: sa bon 'byung sogs phyi rol lo //
analyzed: sa bon 'byung sogs phyi rol lo //
translated: The external is the seed, the elements, and so on.

original: 'brel pa tsam ni 'di dag min //üîΩgang na dngos po rkyen gzhan las //
analyzed: 'brel pa tsam ni 'di dag min // gang na dngos po rkyen gzhan las //
translated: They are not mere relations.üîΩIf something arises from other things,

original: kha cig skye bar 'dod na ni //
analyzed: kha cig skye bar 'dod na ni //
translated: Then it is not the case that some things are not produced.

original: rigs dang lung la de mi gnas //
analyzed: rigs dang lung la de mi gnas //
translated: This is not established by reasoning or scripture.

original: gal te bskyed bya'i dngos med na //
analyzed: gal te bskyed bya'i dngos med na //
translated: If there is no thing to be produced,

original: blo yang gang gi rkyen las byung //
analyzed: blo yang gang gi rkyen las byung //
translated: From what condition does the mind arise?

original: 'di dag phan tshun bskyed pa ste //
analyzed: 'di dag phan tshun bskyed pa ste //
translated: These things are mutually produced,

original: de phyir de dag rkyen du shes //
analyzed: de phyir de dag rkyen du shes //
translated: And therefore they are known to be conditions.üîΩThe childish conceive of things

original: drod gsher sra dang g-yo ba yi //üîΩchos rnams byis pas rnam brtags te //
analyzed: drod gsher sra dang g-yo ba yi // chos rnams byis pas rnam brtags te //
translated: As heat, moisture, solidity, and movement.

original: 'dus pa 'di ni chos ma yin //
analyzed: 'dus pa 'di ni chos ma yin //
translated: This aggregation is not a thing,

original: de phyir ngo bo nyid med do //üîΩnad pa'i dbang du sman pa dag /
analyzed: de phyir ngo bo nyid med do // nad pa'i dbang du sman pa dag /
translated: And therefore it has no intrinsic reality.üîΩThe physician, in accordance with the patient‚Äôs condition,

original: bya ba tha dad ston mod kyi //
analyzed: bya ba tha dad ston mod kyi //
translated: Prescribes different treatments.

original: de la gtsug lag tha dad med //
analyzed: de la gtsug lag tha dad med //
translated: But there is no difference in the scriptures;

original: nad kyis phye ba tha dad do //
analyzed: nad kyis phye ba tha dad do //
translated: The difference is in the patient‚Äôs illness.

original: de bzhin ngas kyang sems can rgyud //
analyzed: de bzhin ngas kyang sems can rgyud //
translated: In the same way, I teach the mind-only doctrineüîΩTo those whose mental continuum

original: nyon mongs nyes pa'i skyon chags pa //üîΩdbang po dag gis stobs shes nas //
analyzed: nyon mongs nyes pa'i skyon chags pa //üîΩdbang po dag gis stobs shes nas //
translated: Is afflicted by the faults of the afflictions.

original: byis pa dag la tshul bshad do //
analyzed: byis pa dag la tshul bshad do //
translated: I explain the way to the childish.

original: nyon mongs dbang po tha dad pas @219a *//
analyzed: nyon mongs dbang po tha dad pas @219a *//
translated: Because of the different faculties of the afflictions,

original: nga yi bstan pa dbyer mi phyed //üîΩyan lag brgyad ldan zhi ba yi //
analyzed: nga yi bstan pa dbyer mi phyed // yan lag brgyad ldan zhi ba yi //
translated: my teachings are not divided.üîΩThe path with eight branches is peaceful,

original: lam ni theg pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: lam ni theg pa gcig yin no //
translated: the single vehicle.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva MahƒÅmati made a request to the BhagavƒÅn:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‚ÄúBhagavƒÅn,

original: mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: impermanence,

original: mi rtag pa nyid do zhes mu stegs byed thams cad kyis rnam par brtags te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid do zhes mu stegs byed thams cad kyis rnam par brtags te /
translated: impermanence, is imputed by all tƒ´rthikas.

original: khyod kyis kyang bstan pa brjod pa thams cad las /
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang bstan pa brjod pa thams cad las /
translated: You also say, in all the teachings you have given,

original: kye ma 'du byed mi rtag ste /
analyzed: kye ma 'du byed mi rtag ste /
translated: ‚ÄòAlas, conditioned things are impermanent;

original: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can no zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can no zhes gsungs na /
translated: they have the quality of arising and ceasing.‚Äô

original: de ci bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'am log pa'am /
analyzed: de ci bcom ldan 'das yang dag pa'am log pa'am /
translated: Is that, BhagavƒÅn, correct or incorrect?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: BhagavƒÅn,

original: mi rtag pa nyid la rnam pa du mchis /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la rnam pa du mchis /
translated: how many kinds of impermanence are there?‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said,

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati,

original: mu stegs byed thams cad kyis rnam pa brgyad du rnam par brtags te ngas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs byed thams cad kyis rnam pa brgyad du rnam par brtags te ngas ni ma yin no //
translated: All tƒ´rthikas imagine it to be eightfold, but I do not.

original: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: la la ni rab tu rtsom pa las rnam par ldog pa mi rtag pa nyid ces zer te /
analyzed: la la ni rab tu rtsom pa las rnam par ldog pa mi rtag pa nyid ces zer te /
translated: some say that impermanence is the reversal of what has been started.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: rab tu rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin te /
analyzed: rab tu rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin te /
translated: what is called ‚Äústarted‚Äù is arising,

original: mi skye ba ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi skye ba ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: and non-arising is impermanence.

original: kha cig ni dbyibs rnam par ldog pa mi rtag pa nyid ces zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni dbyibs rnam par ldog pa mi rtag pa nyid ces zer ro //
translated: Some say that impermanence is the reversal of shape.

original: kha cig ni gzugs nyid mi rtag pa zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs nyid mi rtag pa zhe'o //
translated: Some say that form itself is impermanent.

original: kha cig ni gzugs 'gyur ba'i bye brag gzhan ni mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs 'gyur ba'i bye brag gzhan ni mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: Some say that another transformation of form is impermanence.

original: chos thams cad bar chad @219b med par rgyun du rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa bral ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad bar chad @219b med par rgyun du rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa bral ba /
translated: All phenomena are uninterruptedly and naturally disintegrating, free from separation,

original: 'o ma las zhor 'gyur ba'i bye brag tha dad pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad la'ang mi mthong ba dang / zhig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid 'jug ce'o //
analyzed: 'o ma las zhor 'gyur ba'i bye brag tha dad pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad la'ang mi mthong ba dang / zhig pa'i mi rtag pa nyid 'jug ce'o //
translated: Just as from milk there is a different transformation into curd, so too, non-seeing and the impermanence of destruction apply to all things.

original: kha cig ni dngos po mi rtag par rtog go /
analyzed: kha cig ni dngos po mi rtag par rtog go /
translated: Some conceive of impermanence as a thing.

original: kha cig ni dngos po'i dngos po med par mi rtag par rtog go /
analyzed: kha cig ni dngos po'i dngos po med par mi rtag par rtog go /
translated: Some conceive of impermanence as the non-existence of a thing.

original: kha cig ni mi rtag pa'ang de'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i mi rtag pa zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni mi rtag pa'ang de'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i mi rtag pa zhe'o //
translated: Some say that all phenomena are impermanent in the sense of non-arising, because impermanence is included within that.

original: de la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: de la / blo gros chen po /
translated: To that, MahƒÅmati,

original: dngos po'i dngos po med pa mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i dngos po med pa mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: the so-called impermanence of the non-existence of a thing is as follows:

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'jig cing mi dmigs pa dang / 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'jig cing mi dmigs pa dang / 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The destruction and non-apprehension of the characteristics of the elements and the derivative forms, and the non-engagement of the essence of arising.

original: de la skye ba med pa'i mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la skye ba med pa'i mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Regarding that, the so-called impermanence of non-arising is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rtag tu mi rtag pa dang / yod pa dang med pa las mi 'byung ba dang / chos thams cad mi mthong ba dang / rdul phra mo'i bar du brtags na mi mthong ba 'di ni mi skye ba'i tshig bla dvags kyi skye ba ni ma yin no; ;blo gros chen po /
analyzed: rtag tu mi rtag pa dang / yod pa dang med pa las mi 'byung ba dang / chos thams cad mi mthong ba dang / rdul phra mo'i bar du brtags na mi mthong ba 'di ni mi skye ba'i tshig bla dvags kyi skye ba ni ma yin no; ;blo gros chen po /
translated: When analyzed down to the most subtle atomic particle, it is not seen.üîΩMahatma,

original: de ni mi skye ba mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de ni mi skye ba mi rtag pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: this is the characteristic of impermanence in the non-arising of things.

original: de khong du ma chud pas mu stegs byed thams cad skye ba mi rtag par smra bar rab tu lhung ngo //
analyzed: de khong du ma chud pas mu stegs byed thams cad skye ba mi rtag par smra bar rab tu lhung ngo //
translated: Because they do not understand this, all the tirthikas fall into the extreme of proclaiming the impermanence of arising.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahatma,

original: gang dngos po mi rtag par 'dod pa ni rang gi blos rnam par brtags pa ste /
analyzed: gang dngos po mi rtag par 'dod pa ni rang gi blos rnam par brtags pa ste /
translated: those who assert that things are impermanent do so by their own mental imputation.

original: dngos po rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Things are neither permanent

original: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di @220a *// lta ste; blo gros chen po /
analyzed: 'di @220a *// lta ste; blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahatma,

original: mi rtag pa ni rang mi 'jig go /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni rang mi 'jig go /
translated: impermanence does not destroy itself.

original: 'di la / blo gros chen po /
analyzed: 'di la / blo gros chen po /
translated: Mahatma,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi dngos po med pa ni mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu'o; ;mi rtag pa med pa'i dngos po thams cad ngo bo med pa mi dmigs te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi dngos po med pa ni mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu'o; ;mi rtag pa med pa'i dngos po thams cad ngo bo med pa mi dmigs te /
translated: The non-entityness of all entities is the effect of impermanence.

original: dbyig pa dang / rdo ba dang / tho ba gang yang rung bas gcag par bya ba dang / gcog pa bzhin phan tshun du bye brag med par snang ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: dbyig pa dang / rdo ba dang / tho ba gang yang rung bas gcag par bya ba dang / gcog pa bzhin phan tshun du bye brag med par snang ba mthong ngo //
translated: The non-entityness of all entities that is not impermanence is not perceived, just as a stick, stone, or hammer is not perceived when it is broken.

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid ni rgyu dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo med pa ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid ni rgyu dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo med pa ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: Therefore, impermanence is the non-entityness of the nature of all entities that are causes, and the effect is the non-entityness of all entities that are effects.

original: 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: This is impermanence.üîΩThis is the effect.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu'o zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu bye brag med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'ang bye brag med do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu'o zhes rgyu dang 'bras bu bye brag med pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'ang bye brag med do //
translated: Because cause and effect are not distinct, cause and effect are also not distinct.

original: dngos po rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad rtag pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rgyu med pa'i phyir dngos po thams cad rtag pa'o //
translated: Because entities have no cause, all entities are permanent.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: dngos po thams cad ngo bo med pa ni rgyu med pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ngo bo med pa ni rgyu med pa yin te /
translated: the non-entityness of all entities is causeless.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du mi chud do //
translated: It is not understood by foolish ordinary beings.

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu mi 'dra ba mi bskyed do //
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu mi 'dra ba mi bskyed do //
translated: A cause does not produce an effect that is not similar to itself.

original: de ste bskyed du zin na dngos po de dag thams cad mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ste bskyed du zin na dngos po de dag thams cad mi rtag pa'i 'bras bu mi 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it did produce it, then all those entities would have an impermanent effect that is not similar to itself.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu bye brag med par 'gyur na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu bye brag med par 'gyur na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: There would be no distinction between cause and effect. But we do see a distinction between cause and effect.

original: gal te de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid dngos po yin na ni bya ba dang / rgyu'i ngo bo dang / mtshan nyid du lhung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de dag gi mi rtag pa nyid dngos po yin na ni bya ba dang / rgyu'i ngo bo dang / mtshan nyid du lhung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If impermanence were an entity, then it would fall into the category of action, cause, and definition.

original: dngos po gcig gam dngos po thams cad du rdzogs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig gam dngos po thams cad du rdzogs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be either one entity or all entities.

original: @220b bya ba'i rgyu dang dngos po'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba'i phyir mi rtag pa bdag nyid mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @220b bya ba'i rgyu dang dngos po'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba'i phyir mi rtag pa bdag nyid mi rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it would fall into the category of action and the definition of an entity, impermanence would be impermanent by itself.

original: mi rtag pa nyid mi rtag pas na dngos po thams cad rtag par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid mi rtag pas na dngos po thams cad rtag par yang 'gyur te /
translated: If impermanence is impermanent, then all entities would be permanent,

original: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because they would be associated with impermanence.

original: de ste mi rtag pa dngos po thams cad kyi nang du song ba yin na ni /
analyzed: de ste mi rtag pa dngos po thams cad kyi nang du song ba yin na ni /
translated: If impermanence is included among all entities,

original: de'i phyir dus gsum du lhung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gsum du lhung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it falls into the three times.

original: de la gang 'das pa'i gzugs ni de dang lhan cig tu zhig go /
analyzed: de la gang 'das pa'i gzugs ni de dang lhan cig tu zhig go /
translated: Among them, past form is destroyed together with it.

original: ma 'ongs pa'ang gzugs mi skye ba'i phyir mi skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'ang gzugs mi skye ba'i phyir mi skyes pa'o //
translated: The future is not born because form is not born.

original: da ltar yang gzugs dang mtshan nyid tha mi dad de /
analyzed: da ltar yang gzugs dang mtshan nyid tha mi dad de /
translated: The present is not different from form.

original: gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas kyi bye brag go /
analyzed: gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi gnas kyi bye brag go /
translated: Form is a particular location of the great elements.

original: 'byung rnams kyi 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni mi 'jig go /
analyzed: 'byung rnams kyi 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni mi 'jig go /
translated: The nature of the elements is not destroyed in the derivative form.

original: mu stegs byed gcig dang tha dad pa spangs pa'i phyir 'byung ba rnams kyi 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni mi 'jig go /
analyzed: mu stegs byed gcig dang tha dad pa spangs pa'i phyir 'byung ba rnams kyi 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni mi 'jig go /
translated: The nature of the elements is not destroyed in the derivative form because the tƒ´rthikas abandon the position that they are the same or different.

original: mu stegs byed thams cad kyi 'byung ba thams cad ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir srid pa gsum po thams cad ni 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: mu stegs byed thams cad kyi 'byung ba thams cad ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir srid pa gsum po thams cad ni 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa yin te /
translated: The nature of all the elements of all the tƒ´rthikas is not destroyed. Therefore, all three existences are the elements and the derivative form.

original: de la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gyur bar gdags so //
analyzed: de la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gyur bar gdags so //
translated: Among them, arising, enduring, and changing are designated.

original: gang la mu stegs byed rnams kyis mi rtag pa nyid du brtag pa 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / tha dad pa'i mi rtag pa gzhan gang yod /
analyzed: gang la mu stegs byed rnams kyis mi rtag pa nyid du brtag pa 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang / tha dad pa'i mi rtag pa gzhan gang yod /
translated: What is impermanent in the sense of being different?üîΩThe elements are not impermanent in the sense of being different, because they do not cease to exist by nature.

original: 'byung ba ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid mi 'jig pas na 'jug pa'ang med /üîΩldog pa'ang med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid mi 'jig pas na 'jug pa'ang med / ldog pa'ang med do //
translated: They do not cease to exist by nature, because they do not arise.

original: de la rab tu rtsom pa las ldog pa mi rtag pa nyid @221a *//
analyzed: de la rab tu rtsom pa las ldog pa mi rtag pa nyid @221a *//
translated: What is impermanent in the sense of reversal?

original: ces bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba gzhan mi rtsom mo //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'byung ba rnams 'byung ba gzhan mi rtsom mo //
translated: The elements are not impermanent in the sense of reversal, because they do not reverse their activity.

original: phan tshun mi mthun pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid pas na bye brag mi brtsom mo //
analyzed: phan tshun mi mthun pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid pas na bye brag mi brtsom mo //
translated: They do not reverse their activity, because they do not have different natures.

original: de dag de'i bye brag med pa dang / yang mi rtsom pa dang / rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rtsom pa la mi rtag pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag de'i bye brag med pa dang / yang mi rtsom pa dang / rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir mi rtsom pa la mi rtag pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: They are not impermanent in the sense of reversal, because they are not different from that and do not reverse themselves.

original: de la dbyibs rnam par ldog pa'i mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dbyibs rnam par ldog pa'i mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: What is impermanent in the sense of a change in shape?

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rab tu 'jig pa'i bar du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rab tu 'jig pa'i bar du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The elements and the derivative matter would not be destroyed.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra mo'i bar du rab tu 'byed cing yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra mo'i bar du rab tu 'byed cing yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù means the analysis and examination of the subtle particles.

original: 'jig pa ni 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dbyibs gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ring thung mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dbyibs gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ring thung mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Destruction is the non-apprehension of long and short due to seeing the shape of the elements and the derivative matter as different.

original: 'byung ba rnams 'jig pa'i phyir rdul phra mo 'byung ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams 'jig pa'i phyir rdul phra mo 'byung ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the subtle particles of the elements, because the elements are destroyed.

original: dbyibs rnam par ldog par lta bas grangs can gyi smra bar lhung ngo //
analyzed: dbyibs rnam par ldog par lta bas grangs can gyi smra bar lhung ngo //
translated: By viewing the reversal of shape, one falls into the SƒÅ·πÉkhya doctrine.

original: de la dbyibs mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la dbyibs mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There, the impermanence of shape is as follows:

original: su la gzugs nyid mi rtag pa de la dbyibs nyid mi rtag pa nyid de 'byung ba rnams kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: su la gzugs nyid mi rtag pa de la dbyibs nyid mi rtag pa nyid de 'byung ba rnams kyi ma yin no //
translated: For whom form itself is impermanent, for them shape itself is impermanent, not for the elements.

original: de ste 'byung ba rnams la mi rtag pa nyid na ni 'jig rten gyi spyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ste 'byung ba rnams la mi rtag pa nyid na ni 'jig rten gyi spyod pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If impermanence belongs to the elements, then worldly usage would not exist.

original: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa med pa na ni dngos po thams cad tshig tsam dang / yang rang gi mtshan nyid yang skye ba mthong ba'i phyir 'jig @221b rten rgyan pan pa'i lta bar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa med pa na ni dngos po thams cad tshig tsam dang / yang rang gi mtshan nyid yang skye ba mthong ba'i phyir 'jig @221b rten rgyan pan pa'i lta bar ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not take into account worldly convention, then all things are mere words, and one would fall into the view of the Lokayatas, because one would see that things arise from their own intrinsic reality.

original: de la 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, impermanence through transformation is as follows:

original: gzugs gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs gzhan du 'gyur ba mthong ba ste /
translated: One sees the transformation of form,

original: 'byung ba rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of the elements.

original: gser gyi dbyibs dang / rgyan 'gyur ba mthong ba bzhin te /üîΩgser ni gser gyi dngos po las gzhan zhig pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: gser gyi dbyibs dang / rgyan 'gyur ba mthong ba bzhin te / gser ni gser gyi dngos po las gzhan zhig pa med mod kyi /
translated: It is like seeing the transformation of the shape and ornament of gold,üîΩbut not the transformation of the gold.üîΩThe shape and ornament of the gold are destroyed,

original: rgyan gyi dbyibs zhig pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyan gyi dbyibs zhig pa yin no //
translated: but the gold is not destroyed.

original: gang rnam par 'gyur ba lhung ba de la sogs pa gzhan dag tu de la sogs pa'i rnam pas mu stegs byed rnams mi rtag par lta ba la rnam par rtog go /
analyzed: gang rnam par 'gyur ba lhung ba de la sogs pa gzhan dag tu de la sogs pa'i rnam pas mu stegs byed rnams mi rtag par lta ba la rnam par rtog go /
translated: The tirthikas imagine that the impermanent is just like this, through the various modes of this and that.

original: 'byung ba rnams ni mes bsregs kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams ni mes bsregs kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The elements are not destroyed by fire, because they have their own intrinsic reality.

original: gcig gis gcig mi tshig go /
analyzed: gcig gis gcig mi tshig go /
translated: They do not understand each other.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,üîΩbecause of the absence of their own characteristics, the elements and the things derived from the elements are cut off.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid med par gyur pas 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dngos po chad par 'gyur ro; ;blo gros chen po /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid med par gyur pas 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dngos po chad par 'gyur ro; ;blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: nga'i ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: nga'i ni rtag pa'ang ma yin /
translated: mine is neither permanent

original: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po khas mi len pa dang / srid pa gsum sems tsam du bstan pa dang / mtshan nyid sna tshogs ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po khas mi len pa dang / srid pa gsum sems tsam du bstan pa dang / mtshan nyid sna tshogs ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because I do not accept external things, because I teach the three existences to be mind only, and because I do not teach the diversity of characteristics.

original: 'byung ba chen po'i gnas kyi bye brag ni 'jug pa'ang med ldog pa'ang med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po'i gnas kyi bye brag ni 'jug pa'ang med ldog pa'ang med do //
translated: The particularities of the abodes of the great elements neither enter nor exit.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnam par rtog pa gnyis su mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa rnam par rtog pa gnyis su mi 'jug ste /
translated: The conceptualization of the elements and the derivatives does not engage in duality.

original: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i 'jug pa gnyis yongs su shes pa dang / phyi rol gyi @222a *//
analyzed: gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa'i 'jug pa gnyis yongs su shes pa dang / phyi rol gyi @222a *//
translated: Because of the absence of the characteristics of apprehended and apprehender, and because of the thorough understanding of the engagement of conceptualization, the external

original: dngos po dang / dngos po med par lta ba dang bral ba dang / rang gi sems tsam du khong du chud pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni rtog pa'i mngon par 'du byed pas 'jug gi mngon par 'du ma byas pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang / dngos po med par lta ba dang bral ba dang / rang gi sems tsam du khong du chud pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni rtog pa'i mngon par 'du byed pas 'jug gi mngon par 'du ma byas pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Because they are free from the views of existence and nonexistence and because they understand that it is only mind, their conceptual thoughts engage through the formation of concepts, not without the formation of concepts.

original: sems dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang bral zhing rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang bral zhing rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are free from mind, conceptual thoughts, existence, and nonexistence and because they understand that it is only the appearance of their own minds,

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi chos thams cad ni rtag pa nyid kyang ma yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi chos thams cad ni rtag pa nyid kyang ma yin /
translated: all mundane and supramundane phenomena, and the supreme phenomena that transcend the mundane, are neither permanent

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor impermanent.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa khong du ma chud pa'i phyir lta ba ngan pa mtha' gnyis su lhung ba'i bsam pas mu stegs byed gtam gyi skyes bu sngon ma grub pa thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du rtog go /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa khong du ma chud pa'i phyir lta ba ngan pa mtha' gnyis su lhung ba'i bsam pas mu stegs byed gtam gyi skyes bu sngon ma grub pa thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du rtog go /
translated: Because they do not understand their own conceptual thoughts, all the non-Buddhists, who are people who talk nonsense and are not established in the past, think that everything is impermanent.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati,

original: mu stegs byed thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog gi tshig tu rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mu stegs byed thams cad dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog gi tshig tu rnam par rtog pa las byung ba'i chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: all phenomena that arise from the conceptualization of words, whether of the tƒ´rthikas, worldly people, the supramundane, or the supreme supramundane, have three characteristics.

original: byis pa lta bu'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du mi chud do //
analyzed: byis pa lta bu'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du mi chud do //
translated: They are not understood by ordinary foolish people.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya ste /
translated: Regarding this, it is said:üîΩThe cessation of activity,üîΩthe transformation of the aspects of shape,

original: rab tu rtsom pa rnam ldog dang // dbyibs kyi rnam pa gzhan gyur dang // gzugs dang dngos po mi rtag par //
analyzed: rab tu rtsom pa rnam ldog dang // dbyibs kyi rnam pa gzhan gyur dang // gzugs dang dngos po mi rtag par //
translated: and the impermanence of form and things

original: mu stegs can @222b rnams myos shing rtog /üîΩ'byung ba 'byung bas nyid gnas pas //
analyzed: mu stegs can @222b rnams myos shing rtog / 'byung ba 'byung bas nyid gnas pas //
translated: are what the tƒ´rthikas are deluded about and imagine.üîΩBecause the elements abide in their own nature,

original: dngos po rnams la 'jig pa med //
analyzed: dngos po rnams la 'jig pa med //
translated: things do not perish.

original: lta ba sna tshogs bying bas na //
analyzed: lta ba sna tshogs bying bas na //
translated: Because they are submerged in various views,

original: mu stegs can dag mi rtog go /
analyzed: mu stegs can dag mi rtog go /
translated: the tƒ´rthikas do not understand.

original: mu stegs can na dag gang la yang //
analyzed: mu stegs can na dag gang la yang //
translated: For the tƒ´rthikas, there is

original: 'jig pa med cing 'byung ba'ang med //
analyzed: 'jig pa med cing 'byung ba'ang med //
translated: neither perishing nor arising.

original: 'byung ba 'byung ba'i dngos rtag na //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'byung ba'i dngos rtag na //
translated: If the arising of the elements were permanent,

original: ci la mi rtag nyid du rtog /
analyzed: ci la mi rtag nyid du rtog /
translated: What is it that you imagine to be impermanent?

original: 'di dag thams cad sems tsam ste; ;gzung dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por ni //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad sems tsam ste; ;gzung dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por ni //
translated: All of this is mind only,

original: rnam pa gnyis su sems 'jug ste //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su sems 'jug ste //
translated: With the mind operating in two modes,üîΩAs the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: bdag dang bdag gi yong med do //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi yong med do //
translated: There is no self and no entity of mine.

original: tshangs la sogs pa gnas kyi bar //
analyzed: tshangs la sogs pa gnas kyi bar //
translated: From the abode of BrahmƒÅ on down,

original: sems tsam du ni ngas bshad de //
analyzed: sems tsam du ni ngas bshad de //
translated: I have taught that everything is mind only.

original: sems tsam po ni ma rtogs par //
analyzed: sems tsam po ni ma rtogs par //
translated: Without realizing that everything is mind only,

original: tshangs la sogs pa 'grub pa min //
analyzed: tshangs la sogs pa 'grub pa min //
translated: BrahmƒÅ and the rest will not be attained.

original: langkar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: langkar gshegs pa las /
translated: From the La·πÖkƒÅvatƒÅra S≈´tra,

original: mi rtag pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o ////
translated: The third chapter on impermanence.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva MahƒÅmati made a request to the Blessed One:

original: 'gog pa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa gang gis bdag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams 'gog pa'i bde pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgor rmongs par mi 'gyur zhing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang /üîΩmu stegs byed rnams rmongs par mi ltung bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad @223a *//
analyzed: 'gog pa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa gang gis bdag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzhan rnams 'gog pa'i bde pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgor rmongs par mi 'gyur zhing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs byed rnams rmongs par mi ltung bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad @223a *//
translated: The characteristics of the sequence of cessation, by which I and other bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas will not be confused about the door to entering the bliss of cessation, and so that the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas,

original: kyi 'gog pa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la bshad du gsol //
analyzed: kyi 'gog pa'i go rims kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i mtshan nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la bshad du gsol //
translated: and tƒ´rthikas will not fall into confusion, the characteristics of the sequence of cessation of all bodhisattvas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and pratyekabuddhas, Blessed One, please explain to me!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati,

original: shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang ngas khyod la bshad do //
analyzed: shin tu legs par nyon la yid la gzung zhig dang ngas khyod la bshad do //
translated: listen well and keep it in mind! I will explain it to you.

original: legs so // bcom ldan 'das zhes gsol nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen po bcom ldan 'das la slar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: legs so // bcom ldan 'das zhes gsol nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen po bcom ldan 'das la slar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One said this to him:

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati,

original: sa drug nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sa drug nas bzung ste /
translated: from the sixth ground onward,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and pratyekabuddhas enter the absorption of cessation.

original: sa bdun la ni sems skad cig sems skad cig la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsal bas snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: sa bdun la ni sems skad cig sems skad cig la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bsal bas snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: On the seventh ground, in every instant bodhisattva mahƒÅsattvas enter absorption by dispelling the characteristics of the nature of all things,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag gi 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa can gyis bzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas de dag gi 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa can gyis bzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba'o //
translated: The meditative absorption in cessation of those ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas is characterized by the apprehension of what is conditioned and by the apprehension of characteristics.

original: de bas na de dag gi chos thams cad kyi thob pa bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sna tshogs @223b kyi mtshan nyid med par gyur na mi rung bas sa bdun la ni sems skad cig sems skad cig la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de bas na de dag gi chos thams cad kyi thob pa bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sna tshogs @223b kyi mtshan nyid med par gyur na mi rung bas sa bdun la ni sems skad cig sems skad cig la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Therefore, in order to avoid the undesirable consequence that all their attainments of phenomena would be devoid of the characteristics of non-differentiation and non-variety, they enter meditative absorption in every moment of thought on the seven spiritual levels.

original: chos thams cad kyi dge ba dang mi dge pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pas snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi dge ba dang mi dge pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid khong du ma chud pas snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: They enter meditative absorption because they have not penetrated the individual characteristics of the virtuous and non-virtuous phenomena.

original: de bas na sa bdun la ni gang gis snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ba'i sems skad cig sems skad cig la snyoms par 'jug par 'jug pa mkhas pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na sa bdun la ni gang gis snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ba'i sems skad cig sems skad cig la snyoms par 'jug par 'jug pa mkhas pa med do //
translated: Therefore, on the seven spiritual levels there is no skill in entering meditative absorption in every moment of thought by which one would enter meditative absorption.

original: blo gros chen po /
analyzed: blo gros chen po /
translated: MahƒÅmati!

original: sa brgyad la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'du shes ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa brgyad la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'du shes ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the eighth ground, the conceptual thoughts and discriminations of the minds and mental states of bodhisattvas, ≈õrƒÅvakas, and pratyekabuddhas are reversed.

original: sa dang po dang / sa drug la ni khams gsum pa sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam ste /
analyzed: sa dang po dang / sa drug la ni khams gsum pa sems dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam ste /
translated: On the first and sixth grounds, the three realms are seen to be mind only, mental consciousness only.

original: bdag dang bdag gi med pa rang gi rnam par rtog pa las byung ba phyi rol gyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs su lhung ba ma yin par mngon par rjes su mthong ngo; ;gzhan du na byis pa rnams kyi rang gi sems nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin
